benchmark_details.name: MateInfoUB: A Real-World Benchmark for Testing LLMs in Competitive, Multilingual, and Multimodal Educational Tasks
benchmark_details.overview: This study presents a novel bilingual (Englishâ€“Romanian) multimodal (text and image) dataset of multiple-choice questions derived from a high-level computer science competition, focusing on benchmarking LLM performance on theoretical programming tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of large language models on a bilingual, multimodal dataset in a competitive educational context.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to the Romanian educational context.

data.source: The dataset is derived from real contest problems used in MateInfoUB, an annual computer science contest for 12th-grade students.
data.annotation: Manually written extensive solutions by authors and students for reference.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy was measured by directly comparing model responses against the correct answers from the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of the LLMs on educational tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Gemini 2.5 Exp achieved 76.7% accuracy on hard problems.
methodology.validation: Models were evaluated against the results of students from 2021 to 2024 contests.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset focuses on Romanian high school students and may not generalize to other demographics.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential misuse of the dataset for unauthorized LLM training or assessment.
